newsitem.title: USA: Internet sells $3 mln in shrs to Interwest.
newsitem.headline: Internet sells $3 mln in shrs to Interwest.

text.p: Internet Communications Corp said Thursday that it has executed an agreement to sell $3 million of common stock to Interwest Group Inc, a subsidiary of Anschutz Co.
Interwest has agreed to buy 631,597 shares at $4.75 a share, and it would receive warrants to buy 63,158 shares with an exercise price of $5.70 a share, Internet Communications said.
Shares of Internet Communications closed Wednesday unchanged at 4-1/8. The moves would raise Anschutz's beneficial ownership to 52.9 percent from 46.0 percent.
Anschutz said in a release the investment will allow Internet Communications to grow within its core areas and assist the planned expansion of its outsourcing business.

Internet Communications is a regional network integration company that plans, designs and maintains customized wide-area and local-area networks for voice and data. It also provides enhanced network services, full service Internet access, World Wide Web services and outsourcing capabilities.
